subject: Management
title: Constructive Dissent Norms
description: A quick win: understand Constructive Dissent Norms.

hook.text: A team agreed to a rule: anyone can challenge any idea in the meeting. No retaliation, ever.

buildup.text: Most teams don't have explicit norms about how to disagree. So disagreement feels risky.

discovery.text: Constructive dissent norms make it safe and expected to challenge ideas without personal cost.

twist.text: The norm must be enforced. One act of retaliation destroys years of psychological safety.

climax.text: Model it yourself: challenge your own ideas publicly. Reward people who push back.

punchline.text: Make disagreement a team sport, not a solo risk.

quiz.question: What do constructive dissent norms accomplish?
options: They make it safe to challenge ideas without fear of retaliation
They prevent any disagreement from occurring in meetings
They ensure only the most senior people voice concerns
